communityNote.title: Looking for more wallets?
communityNote.content: Visit the Community tab for mobile wallets and other community-created software.

gui.title: Monero GUI Wallet
gui.subtitle: Graphical wallet developed by the Monero community

features.simpleMode: **Simple mode** for beginners to easily send and receive XMR
features.advancedMode: **Advanced mode** with full control over wallet and node
features.merchantPage: **Merchant page** for easily accepting XMR payments

features.nodeChoice: Choose between local or remote node for blockchain access
features.torI2p: Send transactions over Tor or I2P for extra privacy
features.bootstrap: Use bootstrap node for immediate access while syncing locally
features.hardwareWallet: Compatible with Trezor and Ledger hardware wallets
features.rpc: Includes RPC wallet, ZMQ interface and daemon

core.verifyDescription: You are strongly advised to verify the SHA-256 hash of the file you downloaded. This will confirm that the files you downloaded perfectly match the files uploaded by the Monero development workgroup. Please don't underestimate this step, a corrupted archive could result in lost funds.

wallets.title: Wallets
wallets.subtitle: Community-developed wallet software for different use cases and privacy needs.

cold.title: Cold Wallets
cold.subtitle: Hardware wallets and offline transaction signing apps.

lws.title: LWS Wallets
lws.disclaimer: LWS wallets keep your transaction history synchronized on a remote server for your convenience. Unless you have the option to specify your own servers, this may introduce privacy risks.

descriptions.anonero: Privacy-focused wallet with all communications over Tor.
descriptions.feather: A lightweight, fast, and feature-rich Monero desktop wallet.
descriptions.monerocom: A Monero-only wallet developed by Cake Labs.
descriptions.monerujo: A Monero wallet for Android with advanced features.
descriptions.monfluo: A pure Monero wallet for Android.
descriptions.cakewallet: A multi-coin wallet with Monero and hardware wallet support.
descriptions.eigenwallet: Monero and Bitcoin wallet with built-in atomic swap capabilities.
descriptions.stackwallet: A multi-coin wallet with Monero support for desktop and mobile.
descriptions.edge: A multi-coin wallet with server-side syncing.
descriptions.ledger: Hardware wallet with Monero support via third-party apps.
descriptions.trezor: Hardware wallet with Monero support via third-party apps.
descriptions.cupcake: Offline signer app for use with Cake Wallet/Monero.com.
descriptions.sidekick: Offline signer app for use with Monerujo. Connects via Bluetooth.
descriptions.cuprate: A fast and efficient Monero node implementation written in Rust.

community.disclaimer: This list is for informational purposes only. The Monero Project does not endorse, recommend, or guarantee any service listed here. Always double-check URLs, start with a small test amount if you're unsure, and use every service at your own risk.
